Description:
Detects potential SQL injection attempts via GET requests in access logs.

Author: Saw Win Naung, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Thurein Oo (Yoma Bank)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: SQL Injection Strings In URI
Query: eql select * from _source_ where (cs-method = 'get' and (log like '%@@version%' or log like '%%271%27%3d%271%' or log like '%=select %' or log like '%=select(%' or log like '%=select%20%' or log like '%concat_ws(%' or log like '%concat(0x%' or log like '%from mysql.innodb_table_stats%' or log like '%from%20mysql.innodb_table_stats%' or log like '%group_concat(%' or log like '%information_schema.tables%' or log like '%json_arrayagg(%' or log like '%or 1=1#%' or log like '%or%201=1#%' or log like '%order by %' or log like '%order%20by%20%' or log like '%select * %' or log like '%select database()%' or log like '%select version()%' or log like '%select%20*%20%' or log like '%select%20database()%' or log like '%select%20version()%' or log like '%select%28sleep%2810%29%' or log like '%selectchar(%' or log like '%table_schema%' or log like '%union all select%' or log like '%union select%' or log like '%union%20all%20select%' or log like '%union%20select%' or log like '%'1'='1%') and  not sc-status = '404')
